flawed_nl_solution:
If Pedro has 3 times more gumballs than Alicia, he has 3 * 20 gumballs = <<3*20=60>>60 gumballs more
In total, Pedro has 20 gumballs + 60 gumballs = <<20+60=80>>80 gumballs
When they put their gumballs together, the total number of gumballs in the bowl becomes 20 gumballs + 80 gumballs = <<20+80=130>>130 gumballs
Pedro takes out 40/100 of the gumballs which is 40/100 * 130 gumballs = <<40/100*130=52>>52 gumballs.
The number of gumballs remaining is 130 gumballs - 52 gumballs = <<130-52=78>>78 gumballs
#### 78

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 100, not 130. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
